FuncDef:
The port vlan exclude command specifies VLANs that are not allowed to pass through a peer-link interface.
The undo port vlan exclude command cancels the configuration. The port vlan exclude command specifies VLANs that are not allowed to pass through a peer-link interface. The undo port vlan exclude command cancels the configuration. By default, packets from all VLANs are allowed to pass through a peer-link interface.

ParaDef.Info:
Indicates the start VLAN ID.
For the CE6885-LL in low latency mode, the value ranges from 1 to 1023.
For other models, the value ranges from 1 to 4094.

Indicates the end VLAN ID. The value of <vlan-id2> must be greater than or equal to the value of <vlan-id1>.
For the CE6885-LL in low latency mode, the value ranges from 1 to 1023.
For other models, the value ranges from 1 to 4094.

ExtraInfo: After an interface is configured as a peer-link interface, it is added to all VLANs by default, and no other services can be configured on the interface. You can run the port vlan exclude command to configure the VLANs that are not allowed to pass through the peer-link interface.
